pr_title: Display name of the user who created the feature under title

timeline.bodyText: This is really ui-specific logic and thus doesn't belong in the model.. could you please move this into the viewmodel instead?
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: Note that arguably "subtitle" is as well, and we'll eventually probably want to move away from having that in the model too.
replies.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText:
Agree with @gino-m, I wouldn't use subtitle to store this.
You could add a createdBy field to the ViewModel (which just contains user.displayName) and put the "Added by %s" as a string resource for the view (which also makes it available for translation). That avoids creating a dependency on the context.
replies.author: dturner

timeline.bodyText: We generally don't add "Optional" to optionals unless there's a name clash - In a sense, in this case "optional" can be treated as a quality of the variable like type and nullability (e.g. we don't use "nameString" or "idNullable").

timeline.bodyText: Same comment re "observable" prefix - it can be considered part of how the values are delivered (the how) rather than what is being delivered (the what).
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText:
We only use Resources here, so we should only pass that, not then entire Context to minimize surface area and unnecessary dependencies in internal APIs.
Also, if we make these methods non-static, we can inject the Resources in the constructor and then we don't need to pass it here. This will be useful for testing as well, since we'll be able to replace the FeatureHelper with a mock or fake if necessary.
timeline.author: gino-m
